text: Suggesting that a total T.U.C. membership of eight million was a 'poor show' compared with some countries, he argued that the position needed examination. BEFORE President Kennedy met Mr. Macmillan yesterday morning he was given the views of a wide section of the British people about Polaris submarine bases in this country. An open letter written by Earl Russell hoping that the President's visit to London 'will prove fruitful was handed in at the American Embassy by representatives of the Committee of 100.
